reviews.text: Perhaps the most picturesque station on the reinstated Borders line, though there is perhaps a little too much fresh concrete for it to be described as quaint. Nevertheless, it still has a fairly pleasant ambiance and the view of the surrounding hills from the northbound platform is quite agreeable. Due to the location of the station on a slope, access to northbound trains is via stairs or ramp only, though the latter is fairly gentle. A large bike rack is provided on the southbound platform, as well as a small free car park.
It's just a great village x
